profile.name: Anthony Fu
profile.bio: üö¢ A ship in harbor is safe, but that's not what ships are built for. Building with @vercel, @nuxt. Deep diving into #AI. Passionate about OSS & learning in public. Let's build!

tweets.content: Finally got that tricky animation smooth across all browsers! Used `motion` library, and it's just butter. Sometimes the small wins are the most satisfying. Here's a quick demo: [imagine a GIF link] #frontend #animation
Unpopular opinion: If writing tests feels like pulling teeth, maybe your architecture is too rigid. Good design should invite testability, not fight it. #softwareengineering #testing

Stuck on a tricky CSS flexbox issue for the last hour. My brain is officially melting. Anyone got a secret trick for perfectly centering a dynamically sized image inside a variable-width container? #css #webdevhelp

Copilot is a fantastic assistant, but it's not a replacement for understanding fundamentals. It's like having a co-pilot on your ship ‚Äì great for navigation, but you still need to know how to steer when the storm hits. #AI #coding

Diving into the new WebGPU API today. The learning curve is steep, but the potential for truly native-level graphics on the web is mind-blowing. Time to build something small and shiny! ‚ú® #WebGPU #learninginpublic
Me at a tech conference: 'Wow, that's an amazing talk, I'm going to implement all these best practices!' Me back at my desk Monday: `npm install && coffee.exe` #developerhumor #techconference

Another day, another JavaScript framework. Sometimes I feel like we're building elaborate ships just to cross a puddle. Is the innovation truly improving DX or just adding more layers of abstraction? #frontend #webdev

Excited to see more adoption of the `popover` API in browsers! This is one of those small, but incredibly powerful additions that will simplify a ton of common UI patterns. Less JavaScript, more native browser magic. #webstandards #html #css

React just dropped a major alpha for hooks improvements. Seems like they're really leaning into server components and better hydration. The future of frontend is going to be wild. What are your first impressions? #React #webdev
My code after 6 months: 'Who wrote this mess?!' *git blame* 'Oh... it was me.' Every. Single. Time. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è #developerhumor #coding
Just completed a deep dive into WebAssembly. My brain hurts, but the possibilities are incredible. Feeling like I'm equipping my ship for deeper waters. üåä #WebAssembly #wasm #learning
My Friday ritual: Staring at the deployment logs, silently pleading with the universe not to break production just before the weekend. üôè #deployfriday #webdev

We spend so much time optimizing our builds and bundles, but how much time do we spend optimizing our dev tools pipeline? A slow feedback loop kills productivity faster than anything. #devtools #performance
Big thanks to @some_oss_org for merging my PR fixing a nasty memory leak in their dev tooling! Felt good to contribute back to a project I use daily. üôå #opensource #community

Just finished a pretty intense sprint. Feeling drained but also proud of what the team shipped. Sometimes it's easy to forget the journey when you're focused on the destination. Time to recharge. üîã #worklife #developer
Pushed a small patch to my tiny utility library `anthony-utils` fixing a subtle edge case. If you're using it, update soon! Every little bit helps the ship stay afloat. üö¢ #opensource #javascript

Experimenting with Bun as a replacement for Node for a microservice. So far, the speedup is noticeable for installs and script execution. Still early days, but I'm cautiously optimistic. #BunJS #javascript
